sen.j: 京都都市圏（きょうととしけん）は、京都府京都市を中心とする経済地域で、京都市と周辺の衛星都市とをまとめて指す呼び名である。
sen.e: Kyoto urban area, which is the designation of Kyoto City and its peripheral satellite cities collectively, means an economic zone surrounding Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyoto urban area, which is the designation of Kyoto City and its peripheral satellite cities collectively, means an economic zone surrounding Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyoto urban area, which is the designation of Kyoto City and its peripheral satellite cities collectively, means an economic zone surrounding Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 2000年（平成12年）時点での京都都市圏の人口は約258万人、これは日本で第4位の規模。
sen.e: The population of Kyoto urban area as of 2000 is about 2.58 million, which is the forth scale in Japan.
The population of Kyoto urban area as of 2000 is about 2.58 million, which is the fourth scale in Japan.
The population of Kyoto urban area as of 2000 is about 2.58 million, which is the fourth scale in Japan.

sen.j: 範囲は京都府中部から滋賀県の琵琶湖南岸に及ぶ。
sen.e: It ranges from the central part of Kyoto prefecture to the south bank of Lake Biwa in Shiga Prefecture.
It ranges from the central part of Kyoto Prefecture to the south bank of Lake Biwa in Shiga Prefecture.
It ranges from the central part of Kyoto Prefecture to the south bank of Lake Biwa in Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 京都市と大津市の2つの都道府県庁所在地を含む。
sen.e: It embraces two prefectural capitals namely Kyoto City and Otsu City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It embraces two prefectural capitals namely Kyoto City and Otsu City.
It embraces two prefectural capitals namely Kyoto City and Otsu City.

sen.j: このため、京都府と滋賀県を併せた称である「京滋」や、両市から1字ずつとった「京津」が、そのまま京都都市圏の別称として用いられる場合がある。
sen.e: For this reason, sometimes "Keiji", which is the combination of characters one from "Kyoto" Prefecture and one from "Shiga" Prefecture, or alternatively "Keishin" which is the combination of characters one from "Kyoto" City and one from "Otsu" City, is used to mean Kyoto urban area.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For this reason, sometimes 'Keiji,' which is the combination of characters one from 'Kyoto' Prefecture and one from 'Shiga' Prefecture, or alternatively 'Keishin' which is the combination of characters one from 'Kyoto' City and one from 'Otsu' City, is used to mean Kyoto urban area.

For this reason, sometimes 'Keiji,' which is the combination of characters one from 'Kyoto' Prefecture and one from 'Shiga' Prefecture, or alternatively 'Keishin' which is the combination of characters one from 'Kyoto' City and one from 'Otsu' City, is used to mean Kyoto urban area.

sen.j: 京都都市圏・大阪都市圏・神戸都市圏を併せて「京阪神」または「京阪神大都市圏」とする場合もある。
sen.e: Occasionally designations of "Keihanshin" or "Keihanshin Metropolitan area" may be used to mean Kyoto urban area, Osaka urban zone, and Kobe urban zone all together.
Occasionally designations of 'Keihanshin' or 'Keihanshin Metropolitan area' may be used to mean Kyoto urban area, Osaka urban area, and Kobe urban area all together.
Occasionally designations of 'Keihanshin' or 'Keihanshin Metropolitan area' may be used to mean Kyoto urban area, Osaka urban area, and Kobe urban area all together.

sen.j: 定義
sen.e: Definition
Definition

sen.j: 10%都市圏
sen.e: 10% Urban Area
10 percent Urban Area
10 percent Urban Area

sen.j: 2000年（平成12年）国勢調査「常住地による従業・通学市区町村別15歳以上就業者及び15歳以上通学者数」に基づいた、京都市を中心市とする都市雇用圏（10%通勤圏）の人口は約258万人。
sen.e: According to the national census in 2000 on "Population of students and the employed 15 years old or more by place of work and schooling according to usual place of residence", the population of Urban Employment Area (UEA) (10% commuting area: a suburb more than 10% of whose population commuting to the central city) surrounding Kyoto City is about 2.58 million.

According to the national census in 2000 on 'Population of students and the employed 15 years old or more by place of work and schooling according to usual place of residence,' the population of Urban Employment Area (UEA) (10 percent commuting area: A suburb more than 10 percent of whose population commuting to the central city) surrounding Kyoto City is about 2.58 million.

According to the national census in 2000 on 'Population of students and the employed 15 years old or more by place of work and schooling according to usual place of residence,' the population of Urban Employment Area (UEA) (10 percent commuting area: A suburb more than 10 percent of whose population commuting to the central city) surrounding Kyoto City is about 2.58 million.

sen.j: 都市圏の変遷
sen.e: A change in the Urban Area
A change in the Urban Area
A change in the Urban Area

sen.j: 都市雇用圏（10%通勤圏）の変遷
sen.e: A change in the Urban Employment Area (UEA) (10% commuting area)
A change in the Urban Employment Area (UEA) (10 percent commuting area)
A change in the Urban Employment Area (UEA) (10 percent commuting area)

sen.j: ※10%通勤圏に入っていない自治体は、各統計年の欄で灰色かつ「-」で示す。
sen.e: * Gray colored column plus a mark"-" indicates that the autonomous body is not included in the UEA.
Gray colored column with a mark '-' indicates that the autonomous body is not included in the 10 percent commuting area.
Gray colored column with a mark '-' indicates that the autonomous body is not included in the 10 percent commuting area.

sen.j: 1997年4月1日、綴喜郡京田辺市が、市制施行して京田辺市となった。
sen.e: On April 1, 1997, Kyotanabe City of Tsuzuki-gun became Kyotanabe City by incorporation of city.
On April 1, 1997, Kyotanabe City of Tsuzuki-gun County became Kyotanabe City by incorporation of city.
On April 1, 1997, Kyotanabe City of Tsuzuki County became Kyotanabe City by incorporation of city.

sen.j: 2001年10月1日 栗太郡栗東町が市制施行して栗東市となった。
sen.e: On October 1, 2001, Ritto-cho, Kurita-gun became Ritto City by incorporation of city.
On October 1, 2001, Ritto Town, Kurita-gun County became Ritto City by incorporation of city.
On October 1, 2001, Ritto Town, Kurita County became Ritto City by incorporation of city.

sen.j: 2004年10月1日、野洲郡野洲町と中主町の2町が市町村合併して野洲市となった。
sen.e: On October 1, 2004, two cities, namely Yasu-cho and Chuzu-cho both in Yasu-gun, became Yasu City by municipal merger.
On October 1, 2004, two cities, namely Yasu Town and Chuzu Town both in Yasu-gun County, became Yasu City by municipal merger.
On October 1, 2004, two cities, namely Yasu Town and Chuzu Town both in Yasu County, became Yasu City by municipal merger.

sen.j: 2005年4月1日、京都市が京北町を編入し、同市右京区の一部とした。
sen.e: On April 1, 2005, Kyoto City incorporated Keihoku-cho to make it a part of Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
On April 1, 2005, Kyoto City incorporated Keihoku Town to make it a part of Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
On April 1, 2005, Kyoto City incorporated Keihoku Town to make it a part of Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 2005年10月11日、丹波町・瑞穂町 (京都府)・和知町の3町が合併して京丹波町となった。
sen.e: On October 11, 2005, three cities, namely Tanba-cho, Mizuho-cho (Kyoto Prefecture), and Wachi-cho, were merged to become Kyotanba-cho.
On October 11, 2005, three cities, namely Tanba Town, Mizuho Town (Kyoto Prefecture), and Wachi Town, were merged to become Kyotanba Town.
On October 11, 2005, three cities, namely Tanba Town, Mizuho Town (Kyoto Prefecture), and Wachi Town, were merged to become Kyotanba Town.

sen.j: 2006年1月1日、船井郡園部町・八木町・日吉町_(京都府)、北桑田郡美山町_(京都府)の4町が合併して南丹市となった。
sen.e: On January 1, 2006, four towns, namely Sonobe-cho Funai-gun, Yagi-cho, Hiyoshi-cho (Kyoto Prefecture), and Miyama-cho Kita-Kuwada-gun (Kyoto Prefecture) merged to make Nantan City.

On January 1, 2006, four towns, namely Sonobe Town, Yagi Town, and Hiyoshi Town in Funai-gun County (Kyoto Prefecture), and Miyama Town in Kitakuwada-gun County (Kyoto Prefecture) merged to make Nantan City.

On January 1, 2006, four towns, namely Sonobe Town, Yagi Town, and Hiyoshi Town in Funai-gun County (Kyoto Prefecture), and Miyama Town in Kitakuwada County (Kyoto Prefecture) merged to make Nantan City.

sen.j: 2006年3月20日、大津市が志賀町 (滋賀県)を編入合併した。
sen.e: On March 20, 2006, Otsu City absorbed Shiga-cho (Shiga Prefecture).
On March 20, 2006, Otsu City absorbed Shiga Town (Shiga Prefecture).
On March 20, 2006, Otsu City absorbed Shiga Town (Shiga Prefecture).
